subtitles.text: It's time for another episode of Upgami. This time we will be talking with Maho Akiyama of Tsubaki Factory and Kirara Yonemura of Ochanomoto.
This is a program that takes you behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the Upfront Group.
We will show you the process of our recording and rehearsal.
Now then, let's start with a behind-the-scenes look at the two MCs.
I, Akiyama, have shortened my hair for the first time in a while.
Cute.
Thank you very much.
I've always had long hair and I've been wanting to have a haircut ever since I joined Hello!
It takes a lot of courage and I haven't had my hair cut since I was born,
I had never had my hair cut since I was born, so I really wasn't sure what to do,
I was wondering what I should do, but Saori Onoda, a member of the group, had done hair toning about 2 or 3 years ago,
That's how I came to know about hair donation,
I wanted to donate my hair at least once in my life,
I wanted to donate my hair at least once in my life, so I decided to do it this time.
It's wonderful. It's so nice.
I'm so happy. But I feel like the way I dance and express myself has changed a bit,
It's fresh and fun every time.
So, what about you, Kiura-chan?
I, Yonemura, had the opportunity to hold the first Christmas event as a franchisee of Ocha-no-Ma.
First time, huh? How was it?
We all dressed up in Christmas costumes for the event,
I thought it was really cute, Christmas for the tea ceremony horses.
I thought it was really cute.
Really?
I saw the pictures.
They were so cute and looked great on everyone.
Thank you very much.
Then we went down to the audience and sang "Jingle Bells" at first.
It was the first time for Ocha-no-Ma to sing in the audience, so it was very fresh and fun.
But really, a Christmas event is only once a year.
I think it was a lot of fun to be a little more relaxed and spontaneous than usual because only our fans were there,
At the Subaru Factory Christmas event, we had a shuffle unit,
At the Subaru Factory Christmas event, we had a shuffle unit, and Yofurno performed a song by Bow,
She suggested that we should do it with a treasure chest. She suggested that we should perform with a boupei, and we performed with it on.
Is ho-pei a Christmas thing?
I don't know, but I think it was a very enjoyable Christmas event.
Sounds like fun.

We've just finished shooting the music video for "A Small World"!
I think the highlight of this song is the scene in the desert.
We did a lot of different movements, so I'm looking forward to seeing how the music video turned out.
I'm looking forward to seeing how it turned out.
And in the scene where they walk around the city, they wear trench coats and so on.
I was conscious of walking around Shibuya in a cool and mature way.
I hope people will pay attention to that.
This song goes back and forth from a big scale story to a small everyday story.
The back and forth in the lyrics is very interesting.
I also think that as I sing the song. I'm also thinking about it as I sing.
I hope that you will listen to my songs and feel the joy and fun of them.
I hope that you will be able to hear and feel the joy and fun of this song.
I think I will have many more opportunities to sing in the future.
I'm sure there will be many more opportunities to sing in the future, so I hope that many of you will listen to it.
It was wonderful, wasn't it?
I've always loved Risa Ogata's eyes, and they are indeed beautiful.
Her eyes are a little brownish.
I always liked the way they shined when she appeared on camera.
I always thought they were so beautiful.
But in the music video, your eyes seem to sparkle a lot.
And the clothes she was wearing in the desert scene looked really good on her.
The music video has a very fragile feel to it.
I thought it had a lot of those elements in it.
It's a music video that makes you want to watch it over and over again.
I, Risa Ogata, also thought the world view was wonderful.
I thought the song seemed to be quite difficult to express.
But it was totally beautiful.
Just standing there, it was like a picture.
I was glued to the stage.
I thought it was really wonderful, with a view of the world that only Risa Ogata could bring out.
That's all for Risa Ogata, Small World, the making of the music video shooting.
Thanks for your hard work!
Thank you for all your hard work!

It's time to say goodbye to Shigeru Akiyama and Kirara Yonemura!
We've seen a lot of different videos this time, but this is the last one for the year 2023, so how do you feel about this past year?
Well, in July, Ochanoma released a single called "Quattro English Name Single" which had 4 songs with English names, and it left a great impression on me.
I was very impressed with that single.
I spent a lot of time with the members, and I think it helped us strengthen our bond.
I'm going to listen to a lot of new songs.
Thank you very much.
I think we, Tsubaki Factory, had a lot of new challenges this year,
First of all, we started with a live band.
We have been dreaming of live performance for a long time, but we also had an overseas tour and the first graduation live for the graduating members.
I think that I have been able to take on many new challenges, and it is very important for me to speak out about my dreams.
I think it is very important to express our dreams out loud, so I would like to continue to express what I want to do in the next year.
Now, as this is the last live broadcast of 2023, we will not be broadcasting on January 8, 2024, and the next live broadcast will be on January 11 at 19:00.
UpCami will take you behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the UpFront Group.
Please subscribe to our channel to get a glimpse of what you don't normally see.
In this episode of UpCami, we are joined by Maasa Akiyama of Tsubaki Factory and Kirola Inouemura of Ocha-no-Ma.
Bye bye!
